column1: Presbyopia is a condition in which the lens of the eye loses its ability to focus.
The health care provider will perform a general eye exam.
With the use of contact lenses, some people choose to correct one eye for near and one eye for far vision.
There are also bifocal contact lenses that can correct for both near and far vision in both eyes.
New surgical procedures are being evaluated that can also provide solutions for people who do not want to wear glasses or contacts.
One promising procedure involves implanting a lens or a pinhole membrane in the cornea.
Call your health care provider or ophthalmologist if you have eye strain or have trouble focusing on close objects.
